org.ndnx.ndn.profiles.security.access
Class AccessControlPolicyMarker

java.lang.Object
  org.ndnx.ndn.impl.encoding.GenericXMLEncodable
      org.ndnx.ndn.profiles.security.access.AccessControlPolicyMarker
All Implemented Interfaces:
XMLEncodable, PolicyMarker
public class AccessControlPolicyMarker
extends GenericXMLEncodable
implements PolicyMarker

We identify policies that apply to a given namespace (subtree of the name tree) by placing policy markers, as data, into that namespace. (Questions of how to authenticate these markers is up to the policy and namespace; they are signed as regular NDNx data and authentication policies can be based on signer information.) This class specifies a policy marker used to indicat that a given namespace is under access control, and to specify what access control scheme should be used to protect and retrieve data in that namespace (questions of whether organizing access control by namespace are left to future work). This object contains a small amount of data -- the access control profile used for the namespace (a string, used to index into a map of classes implementing that policy string), a set of ParameterizedName, defining mappings from strings to names within this namespace of interest to a given access control scheme (e.g. a prefix where access control groups might be defined, etc), and then a KeyValueSet of other, arbitrary parameters, for use by an access control scheme to store additional policy information that it requires.

create

public static void create(ContentName name,
                          NDNFlowControl.SaveType saveType,
                          NDNHandle handle)
                   throws IOException
Set up a part of the namespace to be under access control. This method writes the root block to a repository. Type-specific initialization (e.g. writing ACLs) needs to be handled by the appropriate subclass.

Parameters:
name - The top of the namespace to be under access control
Throws:
IOException
ConfigurationException

create

public static AccessControlManager create(ContentName name,
                                          ContentName profileName,
                                          ArrayList<ParameterizedName> parameterizedNames,
                                          KeyValueSet parameters,
                                          NDNFlowControl.SaveType saveType,
                                          NDNHandle handle)
                                   throws IOException,
                                          InvalidKeyException
Set up a part of the namespace to be under access control. This method writes the root block to a repository. This needs to be generic, and can't know about particular access control types. It will make and initialize an access control manager of the appropriate type for this namespace, load it into the search path, and hand it back. Type-specific initialization must be done by the caller.

Parameters:
name - The top of the namespace to be under access control
parameterizedNames -
parameters -
saveType -
handle -
Throws:
IOException
ConfigurationException
InvalidKeyException

decode

public void decode(XMLDecoder decoder)
            throws ContentDecodingException
Description copied from interface: XMLEncodable
Decode this object during an ongoing decoding pass; this is what subclasses generally need to know how to implement. Reads just the object itself, higher-level processes have handled start and end document if need be. Allows object to be read using the same code whether it is a top-level element written alone, or nested inside another element.

Specified by:
decode in interface XMLEncodable
Specified by:

Parameters:
decoder - the decoder being used; encapsulates state including the codec being used as well as the input source and current offset

public long getElementLabel()
Description copied from interface: XMLEncodable
Allow the encoder/decoder to retrieve the top-level element name programmatically. This allows subclasses to rename elements without changing their encoder/decoders.
